F3127860DFE401315B2568A86D17958E.description: Students will understand that the exchange of goods and services around the world creates economic interdependence between people in different places.

F3123D30DFE401315B2468A86D17958E.description: Students will examine the patterns and results of international trade [International trade].

F311FF60DFE401315B2368A86D17958E.description: Students will identify human wants and the various resources and strategies which have been used to satisfy them over time.

F311B390DFE401315B2268A86D17958E.description: Students will understand different types of economic systems and how they change [Economic systems].

F3117080DFE401315B2168A86D17958E.description: Students will understand how barter, money, and other media are employed to facilitate the exchange of resources, goods, and services.

F3112AB0DFE401315B2068A86D17958E.description: Students will examine the interaction of individuals, families, communities, businesses, and governments in a market economy [Macroeconomics].

F310E6A0DFE401315B1F68A86D17958E.description: Students will apply the concept that economic choices require the balancing of costs incurred with benefits received.

F3108AE0DFE401315B1E68A86D17958E.description: Students will understand that individuals and families with limited resources undertake a wide variety of activities to satisfy their wants.

F3102BB0DFE401315B1D68A86D17958E.description: Students will analyze the potential costs and benefits of personal economic choices in a market economy [Microeconomics].
